mesh-svg(1) General Commands Manual mesh-svg(1)

NAME

mesh-svg - Render a 2D mesh into a SVG image

SYNOPSIS

mesh-svg [input.mesh [output.svg]]

DESCRIPTION

mesh-svg renders a 2D mesh as a SVG, optimizing for output size.

If input.mesh is omitted or is -, it is read from standard input. If output.svg is omitted or is -, it is written to standard output.

Only some specific mesh formats are supported. See apply-part(1)'s INPUT FORMAT for details.

OPTIONS

-h, --help

Show a help message and exit.

--version

Show version information and exit.

-o, --no-optimize

Do not merge elements of the same ref/color together.

By default, mesh-svg merges elements of the same color together in the SVG, so that the visuals stay the same but file size is drastically reduced. This argument disables this behavior.

SEE ALSO

apply-part(1) apply-weight(1)

AUTHORS

For more information on coupe development, see <https://github.com/LIHPC-Computational-Geometry/coupe>.
